channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Show of Allegiance to Trump, and Menendez Is Convicted
item.description: Plus, a U.S. crisis hotline answers 10 million calls.

item.title: Hiker’s Death Prompts Move to Allow Wider Bear Cull in Romania
item.description: But some experts described the planned cull as excessive and said it would not keep people safe.

item.title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy says whether you’re ‘ravenous’ about one thing will determine if your career is a success or stagnates
item.description: In Amazon’s CEO Andy Jassy’s experience, those who seek to improve themselves continuously are the ones who see their careers fly.

item.title: A Guide to the King’s Speech: Crown Jewels, Black Rod and a Mace
item.description: When King Charles unveiled the new U.K. government’s agenda in Parliament on Wednesday, he was surrounded by rituals that nodded to hundreds of years of history.

item.title: A Guide to the King’s Speech: Crown Jewels, Black Rod and a Mace
item.description: When King Charles unveiled the new U.K. government’s agenda in Parliament on Wednesday, he was surrounded by rituals that nodded to hundreds of years of history.

item.title: Malaysian cyberbully who threatened a TikTok user who then committed suicide only had to pay a $21 fine as punishment
item.description: The death of a Malaysian TikTok user has prompted the government to look into criminalizing cyberbullying and increasing accountability among internet service providers.

item.title: World’s Rarest Whale Washes Up on New Zealand Beach
item.description: Only six specimens of the spade-toothed whale have ever been identified. This carcass could be the first that scientists are able to dissect.

item.title: World’s Rarest Whale Washes Up on New Zealand Beach
item.description: Only six specimens of the spade-toothed whale have ever been identified. This carcass could be the first that scientists are able to dissect.

item.title: After water pistols in Barcelona and hunger strikes in Spain, cruise ships may avoid European hotspots where ‘passengers will not be well-treated’
item.description: The world's biggest cruise trade body says it may move to protect passengers' safety amid a wave of overtourism protests.

item.title: Heat Wave in Ukraine Further Strains Its Electricity Grid
item.description: To prevent a collapse of the electricity system, crippled by months of Russian attacks, the authorities have imposed rolling blackouts. Experts say it’s a harbinger of what’s to come this winter.

item.title: Heat Wave in Ukraine Further Strains Its Electricity Grid
item.description: To prevent a collapse of the electricity system, crippled by months of Russian attacks, the authorities have imposed rolling blackouts. Experts say it’s a harbinger of what’s to come this winter.

item.title: The Mirage is disappearing from the Las Vegas strip—but new operators Hard Rock will reinvent it as a massive guitar-shaped hotel
item.description: New operators Hard Rock International plan to add 600 rooms to an existing 3,044 in a bright new guitar-shaped hotel.

item.title: Biden vs. His Party
item.description: The Democratic Party’s Biden dilemma is unresolved, even as the momentum against him slows.

item.title: Biden vs. His Party
item.description: The Democratic Party’s Biden dilemma is unresolved, even as the momentum against him slows.

item.title: Ex-CIA analyst specializing in North Korea accused of working as South Korean agent in exchange for Bottega Veneta and Louis Vuitton handbags
item.description: Sue Mi Terry, now a senior fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations, was indicted on charges of operating as a foreign agent for more than a decade.
